titleStmt.title: To the Revd 08. Mr 08. Daniel Jackson
to be humbly presented by Mr 08. Sheridan
in Person, with Respect, care and speed
To be deliver'd by and with Mr 08. Sheridan.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Dear Dan.
Here I return my Trust nor Ask One penny for Remittance;
If I have well perform'd my TaskPray send me an Acquittance.
Too long I've bore this Weighty PackAs Hercules the Sky,
Now take him You Dan: Atlas back,Let me be stander by.
Not all the Witty things You speakIn compass of a day;
Not half the Puns yu make a WeekShou'd Bribe his longer stay.
With me You left him out at NurseYet are You not my Debtor,
For as he hardly can be WorseI ne'er cou'd make him better.
He Rhymes and Puns, and puns and RhimesJust as he did before,
And when he's Lash'd a hundred timesHe rhymes and Puns the more.
When Rods are lay'd and school-boys BumsThe more they frisk and skip;
The School-boy's Top but lowder hummsThe more they use the Whip.
Thus a lean Beast beneath a Load(A Beast of Irish Breed)
Will in a tedious dirty RoadOut-go the Prancing steed.
You knock him down, and down in VainAnd lay him flat before Ye
For soon as he gets up againHe'll strut and Cry Victoria.
At ev'ry stroak of mine he fellt'Tis true he roar'd and Cry'd;
But his impenetrable shellCou'd feel no harm beside.
The Tortoise thus with motion slowWill clamber up a Wall,
Yet senceless to the hardest BlowGets nothing but a fall.
Dear Dan, then why shou'd You or IAttack his Pericrany,
And since it is in Vain to tryWe'll send him to Delany.X10-002D
